intro: Dendranthema zawadzkii var. campanulatum, commonly known as the Campanulatum Chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow central disc, typically blooming in late summer to early autumn. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, aromatic scent. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
